biography.summary: Amy Klobuchar is a United States Senator from Minnesota, serving since 2007. A member of the Democratic Party, she has focused on antitrust enforcement, consumer protection, healthcare, and cross-partisan policy efforts. She has chaired the Senate Democratic Steering Committee since 2019.
biography.early_life: Born May 25, 1960, in Plymouth, Minnesota. She earned a BA from Yale University and a JD from the University of Chicago Law School.
biography.education: BA in history from Yale University; JD from University of Chicago Law School.
biography.career: Prior to entering the Senate, Klobuchar practiced law and served as Hennepin County Attorney.

contact.office_address: 425 Dirksen Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Support strengthening the ACA and expanding access.
Advocate robust antitrust enforcement and consumer protection.

timeline.event: Elected as United States Senator from Minnesota, taking office in 2007.
Appointed as Chair of the Senate Democratic Steering Committee.
Continues service as Senior Senator for Minnesota.
